headline: Orion Corporation: Disclosure Under Chapter 9 Section 10 of the Securities Market Act (BlackRock, Inc.)
summary: ORION CORPORATION STOCK EXCHANGE RELEASE / MAJOR SHAREHOLDER ANNOUNCEMENTS31 December 2025 at 13.00 EET Orion Corporation: Disclosure Under Chapter 9 Section 10 of the Securities Market Act (BlackRock, Inc.) Orion Corporation has received a disclosure under Chapter 9, Section 5 of the Securities Market Act, according to which the total number of Orion shares owned directly, indirectly and through financial instruments by BlackRock, Inc. and its funds decreased on 30 December 2025 below five (5)

headline: Spot Bitcoin ETFs See Fresh Inflows as Liquidity Improves
summary: Spot Bitcoin ETFs returned to net inflows after a long week of losses. These funds raked in $355 million as market activity picked up, and liquidity conditions showed early signs of improvement. The inflow ended 7 straight trading days of withdrawals and slowed a trend that had weighed on sentiment ...

headline: Spot Bitcoin ETFs Pull In $355M, Ending 7- Day Bleed — Is Liquidity Finally Turning?
summary: U.S. spot Bitcoin exchange-traded funds recorded a sharp reversal on December 30, pulling in $355 million in net inflows and ending a seven-day stretch of persistent capital withdrawals. The move marked the strongest daily inflow since mid-December and came after nearly two weeks in which ETF investors steadily reduced exposure ...

headline: Dollar Set for Worst Year Since 2017 With Fed Drama Center Stage
summary: The Bloomberg Dollar Spot Index has fallen about 8% this year so far.  After tumbling in the wake of Donald Trump’s “Liberation Day” tariffs in April, the greenback came under sustained pressure as the president kicked off his aggressive campaign to get a dovish appointee installed as Fed chair next year.  “The biggest factor for the dollar in first quarter will be the Fed,” said Yusuke Miyairi, a foreign-exchange strategist at Nomura.

content.title: Dollar Set for Worst Year Since 2017 With Fed Drama Center Stage
content.summary: The Bloomberg Dollar Spot Index has fallen about 8% this year so far. headline: Umicore - Transparency notifications by BlackRock, Inc.
summary: Transparency notifications by BlackRock, Inc. In accordance with article 14, § 1 of the law of 2 May 2007 on the disclosure of major holdings, Umicore was recently notified by BlackRock, Inc. that it has crossed the legal threshold of 5% for the direct voting rights and equivalent financial instruments downwards on 25 December 2025 and then upwards on 29 December 2025. The total holding of direct voting rights and equivalent financial instruments of BlackRock, Inc. stands at 5.11% on 29 December

headline: The market's 'clear message' against Kevin Hassett leading the Fed
summary: The Federal Reserve is on course for a serious shakeup in 2026 as President Trump seeks to replace chairman Jerome Powell at the end of the latter's term this May. On top of all this, the membership rotation for regional Fed bank presidents could lead to a more hawkish committee and division on policy votes next year. Veda Partners managing partner and director of economic policy Henrietta Treyz comes on Market Catalysts to talk about the odds of supposed frontrunner Kevin Hassett being put in charge of the US central bank. Be sure to check out Jennifer Schonberger's profiles on each of the possible candidates to be the next Fed chair: former Fed Governor Kevin Warsh, the supposed frontrunner and National Economic Council director Kevin Hassett, Fed Governor Chris Waller, Fed Vice Chair of Supervision Michelle Bowman, and BlackRock's (BLK) head of fixed income Rick Rieder. Yahoo Finance interviewed Kevin Hassett in late November 2025. Also watch Henrietta Treyz share her perspective on the potential for Trump tariffs in 2026 and the likelihood of another government shutdown in 2026 over the expiring Affordable Care Act (ACA) subsidies. To watch more expert insights and analysis on the latest market action, check out more Market Catalysts.

content.title: The market's 'clear message' against Kevin Hassett leading the Fed
content.description:
The Federal Reserve is on course for a serious shakeup in 2026 as President Trump seeks to replace chairman Jerome Powell at the end of the latter's term this May. On top of all this, the membership rotation for regional Fed bank presidents could lead to a more hawkish committee and division on policy votes next year.

Veda Partners managing partner and director of economic policy Henrietta Treyz comes on Market Catalysts to talk about the odds of supposed frontrunner Kevin Hassett being put in charge of the US central bank.

Be sure to check out Jennifer Schonberger's profiles on each of the possible candidates to be the next Fed chair: former Fed Governor Kevin Warsh, the supposed frontrunner and National Economic Council director Kevin Hassett, Fed Governor Chris Waller, Fed Vice Chair of Supervision Michelle Bowman, and BlackRock's (BLK) head of fixed income Rick Rieder. Yahoo Finance interviewed Kevin Hassett in late November 2025.

Also watch Henrietta Treyz share her perspective on the potential for Trump tariffs in 2026 and the likelihood of another government shutdown in 2026 over the expiring Affordable Care Act (ACA) subsidies.

To watch more expert insights and analysis on the latest market action, check out more Market Catalysts.
